intro: Knautia csikii, commonly known as the Hungarian clover, is a perennial flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its clusters of pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting blooms and ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
